sentences.en: A blackbird broke in on his reverie with an evening song.
sentences.cn: 一只山鸟的晚歌打断了他的遐想.

sentences.en: At times a flick of self - preservation burned through the fog of reverie.
sentences.cn: 有时求生本能的火花也会在梦幻的浓雾中突然闪烁一下.

sentences.en: He drifted off into sexual reverie again.
sentences.cn: 他迷迷糊糊的又陶醉在男欢女爱的幻梦中了.

sentences.en: He fell into a strange, blissful reverie.
sentences.cn: 他沉溺在一种奇怪的, 幸福的幻觉之中.

sentences.en: He was so lost in reverie that he did not hear the doorbell ring.
sentences.cn: 他深深陷入幻想,连门铃声都没听见.

sentences.en: Helen sighed as her reverie fled, and got up.
sentences.cn: 海伦的遐思给驱散了,她叹了一口气, 站起身来.

sentences.en: His despondent reverie was suddenly interrupted by someone calling his name.
sentences.cn: 忽然有人惊醒了他的沉思.

sentences.en: His reverie had thrown him into severe commotion.
sentences.cn: 他的白日梦把他带入了严重的混乱.

sentences.en: Jude started up from his reverie.
sentences.cn: 裘德从他的冥想中一下醒过来.

sentences.en: Minetta's weariness colored his reverie, made him sad.
sentences.cn: 米尼塔神疲力乏,这也影响了他朦胧的思绪, 给他添上了一层忧伤.

sentences.en: She fell into so deep a reverie.
sentences.cn: 她已深深地沉入一种幻想之中.

sentences.en: She was in a desponding reverie.
sentences.cn: 原来她满腔郁悒,正在一意深思.

sentences.en: She was jolted out of her reverie as the door opened.
sentences.cn: 门一开就把她从幻想中惊醒。

sentences.en: She was snapped out of her reverie by the sound of the door opening.
sentences.cn: 开门声把她从幻想中惊醒了.

sentences.en: She was startled out of her reverie by a loud crash.
sentences.cn: 哗啦一声巨响把她从幻想中惊醒。

sentences.en: The announcer's voice brought Holden out of his reverie.
sentences.cn: 播音员的声音将霍尔登从幻想中惊醒。

trans.tran_en: a state of imagining or thinking about pleasant things, that is like dreaming
